writingDetail.html:
20 Duskmourn Limited MTG Interactions You Need to Know

By Frank Karsten Sept 26, 2024

Duskmourn Limited allows us to face our greatest fears in a plane filled with never-ending torment. Yet this Limited format also offers powerful strategies in the form of sweet two-card combos. Today, we'll take a closer look at 20 combos and interactions to add to your repertoire, allowing you to squeeze the most value out of your cards in your next draft or sealed event.

  1. Reanimate without the detrimental cast trigger Vile Mutilator Market Price: $0.09

Live or Die Market Price: $0.10

The black-white archetype in Duskmourn Limited is all about reanimation, and it's capable of powerful stuff. One of the better creatures to reanimate is Vile Mutilator. It normally comes at the hefty price of sacrificing a creature or enchantment when you cast it for seven mana, but if you return it to the battlefield with Live or Die, then you don't have to pay that.

A similar combo is available in white between Fear of Abduction and Emerge from the Cocoon. However, the ability of Live or Die to return at instant speed can lead to even bigger blowouts.

  1. You're goddamn right! Say Its Name Market Price: $0.08

Altanak, the Thrice-Called Market Price: $0.20

The dream is to play Say Its Name, milling two more copies of Say Its Name, and putting a 9/9 onto the battlefield as early as turn two. Naturally, this is unlikely. For one, you need to draft three copies of Say Its Name, while the expected number of copies of any given common in a draft is generally less than three. Moreover, someone needs to open Altanak, the Thrice-Called. But roughly a quarter of the draft pods at least hold the potential to assemble such a deck.

When you draft a deck with Altanak and three Say Its Name, then the probability of having exactly one Say Its Name in your top 10 cards and milling the other two is 0.3 percent. That's small, but over thousands of games, it's bound to happen at some point over the course of this draft format. You have been warned.

As an additional note related to Altanak: If you draft it, especially in a deck with reanimation spells, then make sure you prioritize Terramorphic Expanse. You can only discard Altanak if you have a target, and Terramorphic Expanse provides that with ease. The free ramp will surely come in handy as well.

  1. Turn bounce into removal Floodpits Drowner Market Price: $0.20

Get Out Market Price: $0.11

You can activate Floodpits Drowner's ability, aiming to remove itself and the creature with the stun counter. Hold priority and respond by casting Get Out, returning Floodpits Drowner to hand. When its ability resolves, the game will try to do as much as possible, shuffling the opposing creature into the library. Meanwhile, Floodpits Drowner is safe in your hand, ready to be used once more. This way, your bounce spell turns into a hard removal spell.

  1. The test is an enigma Fear of Failed Tests Market Price: $0.06

Enter the Enigma Market Price: $0.06

Fear of Failed Tests has the potential to draw a lot of cards, but it has to connect first. Usually by turn six, the opponent will have a suitable blocker with three or more toughness, making this a difficult challenge. Enter the Enigma solves this. Once Fear of Failed Tests can't be blocked, it will draw two cards guaranteed, providing sweet card advantage.

Clammy Prowler and Ragged Playmate provide similar effects, potentially turn after turn. If the opponent doesn't have any fliers, then Jump Scare could also do a lot of work. By boosting Fear of Failed Tests, you'll soar in for four damage and draw four cards!

  1. Shred the loneliness Cynical Loner Market Price: $0.16

Hedge Shredder Market Price: $1.69

This two-card combination gives you a free land every turn. As early as turn four, you can tap Cynical Loner to crew Hedge Shredder, which will trigger the Loner's survival ability at the beginning of your second main phase. You'll search your library for a land and put it into the graveyard, allowing Hedge Shredder to return it to the battlefield. You don't even have to risk either creature in combat to keep the value chain rolling.
